intro: Lathyrus palustris, commonly known as marsh vetch, is a flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Lathyrus palustris thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in damp meadows and along stream banks.
